Class PropertiesUtils

java.lang.Object
org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.PropertiesUtils
public class PropertiesUtils extends Object
Utility-class that simplifies the access to the content of any properties-files at file-system or in classpath.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description

    propEntriesFromFile(File propsFile)

    static Map.Entry<String,String>
    propEntry(Object propName, Object propValue)
    A factory-method produce an instance of type Map.Entry<String,String>
    static Map.Entry<String,String>
    propEntry(Map.Entry<?,?> entry)
    Transforms the entry of type Map.Entry<Object,Object> into the entry of type Map.Entry<String,String> with use of standard transformation via Objects.toString(Object)
    static Map.Entry<String,String>
    propEntryEsc(Object propName, Object propValue)
    The same as propEntry(Object, Object), but the values of properties are escaped with StringEscapeUtils.escapeJava(String), which is very useful and convenient when the content of the result map is going to be represented as JSON or YAML, but some values like System.lineSeparator() requires to be escaped.
    static Map.Entry<String,String>
    propEntryEsc(Map.Entry<?,?> entry)
    The same as propEntry(Map.Entry), but the values of properties are escaped with StringEscapeUtils.escapeJava(String), which is very useful and convenient when the content of the result map is going to be represented as JSON or YAML, but some values like System.lineSeparator() requires to be escaped.

      public static Stream<Map.Entry<String,String>> propEntriesFromURL(URL propsURL)

    • propEntryEsc

      public static Map.Entry<String,String> propEntryEsc(Map.Entry<?,?> entry)
      The same as propEntry(Map.Entry), but the values of properties are escaped with StringEscapeUtils.escapeJava(String), which is very useful and convenient when the content of the result map is going to be represented as JSON or YAML, but some values like System.lineSeparator() requires to be escaped.
      Parameters:
      entry - the entry of type Map.Entry<Object,Object>
      Returns:
      an instance of type Map.Entry<String,String>

    • propEntryEsc

      public static Map.Entry<String,String> propEntryEsc(Object propName, Object propValue)
      The same as propEntry(Object, Object), but the values of properties are escaped with StringEscapeUtils.escapeJava(String), which is very useful and convenient when the content of the result map is going to be represented as JSON or YAML, but some values like System.lineSeparator() requires to be escaped.
      Parameters:
      propName - name of property as Object (the legacy of no generics in Properties-class)
      propValue - value of property as Object (the legacy of no generics in Properties-class)
      Returns:
      an instance of type Map.Entry<String,String>

    • propEntry

      public static Map.Entry<String,String> propEntry(Map.Entry<?,?> entry)
      Transforms the entry of type Map.Entry<Object,Object> into the entry of type Map.Entry<String,String> with use of standard transformation via Objects.toString(Object)
      Parameters:
      entry - the entry of type Map.Entry<Object,Object>
      Returns:
      the entry of type Map.Entry<String,String>

    • propEntry

      public static Map.Entry<String,String> propEntry(Object propName, Object propValue)
      A factory-method produce an instance of type Map.Entry<String,String>
      Parameters:
      propName - name of property as Object (the legacy of no generics in Properties-class)
      propValue - value of property as Object (the legacy of no generics in Properties-class)
      Returns:
      an instance of type Map.Entry<String,String>
